tweets.text: #bluecarbon #saltmarsh #biodiversity #wetlands #coastal @WWTSteart @H_Mossman @RachelBurdenEA @NESouthWest @EnvAgencySW #WorldWetlandsDay https://t.co/aozyZoibId

Really proud of this large pond created near Keswick last year, providing both natural flood management and habitat benefits - island and clean gravels for nesting birds, plus wildflowers for pollinators. We aim to build 7 more this summer! #WorldWetlandsDay @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/yLFB61o38p

Appropriately on #WorldWetlandsDay I'm drafting the first case study of estuarine #rewilding to appear on @RewildingB network pages - @WWTSteart. Astonishing carbon sequestration figs and biodiversity benefits emerging from this @EnvAgency flood risk management project. https://t.co/qX0Rd7eLez

Fangtastic news! Brown Long-eared #Bats are roosting in the loft at our #Kelvedon officeü¶á

As they hadn‚Äôt yet gone into hibernation, when we discovered them back in November, we were able to take some pics.

They‚Äôre believed to be a maternity roost, so we could see some pupsüòç https://t.co/oHSePdB1fa
one of Uxbridge's ancient ponds, all stick-willow'd bayou and wagtail haven @WildLondon @Hillingdon @ColneCAN @EnvAgencySE #WorldWetlandsDay @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/1IPhegmTpF

tweets.text: PLEASE don‚Äôt take your daily exercise along the river bank today. We've had a number of reports of people walking and running through flood water. Please stay away from river edges. Its very dangerous as you can't see the bank and the river is flowing very fast #FloodAware https://t.co/fNDVCCLj4T

@campbellar @EnvAgency We have a contingency plan in place until completion of repair works. Start date is dependent on approval of sand lizard licence, anticipated in Feb. Works expected to take 2-3 wks and include further repairs to damaged geotube and covering exposed sections with steel netting.

Today crews from Walton have been working with our colleges from the @EnvAgencySE  to place temporary flood defences being erected along the Thames from Desborough island through to Weybridge marina. Barriers are in place to limit flooding of the area over the next few days https://t.co/QiUrZddXD4

üíª Great turnout (2‚É£2‚É£0‚É£) for Green Futures webinar today!

üí¨ We heard from @DefraFAS @EnvAgency @stwater & @KellyHewsonF on water rules, chaired by @simonfisherNFU & hosted by @CLAEast 

üîú Sign up for next week's webinar on future policy changes here üëá https://t.co/gXUZIO7mFL

Our officers are supporting the Environment Agency with their work on the installation of the temporary flood defence barrier at Walton Lane. @EnvAgencySE and @MariaHerlihyEA https://t.co/I2iPP1Sn1S #SurreyPrepared #floodaware https://t.co/io5RvSkQfS

@simonayres11 Hi Simon, I'm really sorry to see that this mess has been left behind following this job. We've raised a new complaint under reference number 2005053111 and have asked for this to be picked up as quickly as possible for you Simon. The team will be in touch asap. - Becky

tweets.text: Flood guidance statement is showing as yellow (low) flood risk for Wed and Thu for #Cumbria @EnvAgencyNW teams are #prepared but not expecting to have to stand up based on current forecast.  As always the duty team is monitoring  the forecast 24/7/365 https://t.co/mYU9rXHXfA

All systems go @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE #partnership Riparian Tree Fund. Drier species on slopes with alder to fill on banks - Cosh Beck. Fencing lines along Skirfare and important trout spawning tribs marked up. Benefits - shade, #NFM, diffuse ag #pollution, habitat.... https://t.co/8KkMmTZGHV

@Campsy73 Hi there. St Ives isn't in South Cambridgeshire but rather @huntsdc. But I would think any flood gates are managed by @EnvAgencyAnglia. Please report the blocked drain on the road to @CambsCC at https://t.co/PiErBsV3Z5
Hope this helps.

We're carrying out some essential vegetation removal in the #Clifton area of #York so we can set up work to start making improvements to the Clifton Ings barrier bank. For more information on this work, contact the team at yorkfloodplan@environment-agency.gov.uk #YorkFAS https://t.co/adzA9LphTd

One of our teams were on site yesterday to make emergency repairs to reservoir embankments at West Marsh Ings near #HirstCourtney. The temporary repairs will help to reduce #flood risk and will be in place until permanent repairs can be completed. https://t.co/E5hgJ1LIvB

urls.title: Social Ecological Dynamics of Catchment Resilience
urls.description: Catchment resilience is the capacity of a combined social ecological system, comprised of water, land, ecological resources and communities in a river basin, to deal with sudden shocks and gradual changes, and to adapt and self-organize for progressive change and transform itself for sustainability. This paper proposes that analysis of catchments as social ecological systems can provide key insights into how social and ecological dynamics interact and how some of the negative consequences of unsustainable resource use or environmental degradation can be ameliorated. This requires recognition of the potential for community resilience as a core element of catchment resilience, and moves beyond more structural approaches to emphasize social dynamics. The proposals are based on a review of social ecological systems research, on methods for analyzing community resilience, and a review of social science and action research that suggest ways of generating resilience through community engageme

entity.name: Good Morning Britain
entity.description: Good morning, Britain. Up early and need to catch up on the latest news, weather and sports? Then this weekday morning programme is for you, offering the latest information in such areas as entertainment, health and money. `Good Morning Britain' is the typical morning news and talk show. It features a number of presenters, correspondents and reporters covering what you should know to start your day before heading out the door.
